metadata.title: CVE-2022-42703 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
mm/rmap.c in the Linux kernel before 5.19.7 has a use-after-free related toleaf anon_vma double reuse.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-42703` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-200-generic - 4.15.0-200.211
linux-image-4.15.0-200-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-200.211
linux-image-4.15.0-200-lowlatency - 4.15.0-200.211
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-200-generic - 4.15.0-200.211
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-200-lowlatency - 4.15.0-200.211
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-132-generic - 5.4.0-132.148~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-200.211').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-132.148~18.04.1').
